#Text=CanadaVOTES : NDP candidate Max Lombardi running in Cambridge
#Text=Friday , September 26 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=New Democratic Party candidate Max Lombardi is standing for election in the riding of Cambridge .
#Text=Lombardi is an information technology specialist who has lived in Cambridge for 25 years .
#Text=Held since 2004 by Conservative Gary Goodyear , the riding of Cambridge includes the city of Cambridge , Ontario and the Township of North Dumfries , Ontario .
#Text=Also running in the riding are Gord Zeilstra ( Liberal ) and Scott Cosman ( Green ) .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Max Lombardi , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?

#Text=I am running for the New Democratic Party of Canada in the riding of Cambridge because 140 straight years of Liberal-Conservative promise-breaking governments have fueled intense voter cynicism .

#Text=To restore confidence in our democracy , we need a real change in direction on the bread and butter issues of the economy ; the environment and health care -- a change that moves your family forward -- not backward .
#Text=Cambridge has been my home for most of my life .
#Text=My wife Josie and I want our community to be more prosperous , healthy and fair for our triplets and for all the citizens .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have served in my local school council and ran for school board trustee in 2006 .
#Text=I understand the jobs crisis and that JOB LOSSES HURT FAMILIES .
#Text=When my previous employer MTD Products in Kitchener announced massive layoffs in 2007 , it was a direct blow to my family as well as to many friends and co-workers .
#Text=My family roots are deeply entrenched in the farmer and labour working class .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?

#Text=Affordability and bread-and-butter issues : change direction on global trade deals to set standards high ( not low ) on wages ; labour standards and environmental protection ; invest in good-paying green-collars jobs of the future ; we would create an independent watch dog to monitor and regulate gas prices if necessary .

#Text=Address climate change : set firm caps on emissions with a cap and trade system ; make big polluters pay for their emissions ; use the revenue to invest in new-tech environmental solutions like building and home retrofit programs .
#Text=Improve Health Care : train more doctors and nurses to reduce wait times ; invest in innovation like modern home care ; provide seniors with free drug and dental coverage .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=On the contrary , citizens are more responsive to our message than ever before .
